c74object.name: bach.m2matrixctrl
c74object.digest: Format an llll matrix to be used with matrixctrl or matrix~
c74object.description: Converts an llll matrix in order to pilote a matrix~ or a matrixctrl object.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs the conversion on the most recently input matrix.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Convert llll matrix to matrixctrl or matrix~ form
method.description:
The needed information to fill a matrixctrl with the incoming llll matrix is output. The same information can be sent to matrix~ in order to pilote it.
In the bach environment, a matrix is just a llll having depth two, whose first-level sublllls are the rows of the matrix. For instance the matrix [1 0 0] [0 1 0] [0 0 1] is the 3 by 3 identity matrix. A "good" matrix is supposed to be well formed, i.e. all its rows must have the same length. A matrix is square if the length of the rows (which is the number of columns) is the same as the number of rows.

attribute.name: autosize
attribute.description: Use the autosize attribute to automatically set the size of the destination matrixctrl, according to the size of the incoming llll matrix. Don't use it when piloting a matrix~ object.
